title: Voters in war-torn Myanmar trickle in to 'sham' election | ABC NEWS
description: Five years after a military coup overthrew Myanmar's democratically elected government and ignited a civil war, the country is holding elections that many view as a sham. Human rights activists are calling for a voter boycott. Voter turnout is significantly lower than in the last election, when the National League for Democracy, led by Nobel laureate Aung San Suu Kyi, won decisively before the military staged a coup.  ABC Asia editor Karishma Vyas reports that locals are hesitant to speak to reporters, and the team has been followed during its coverage. title: Critical and rare earth minerals explained using a house | ABC NEWS
description: Surviving the day without critical minerals is practically impossible in the modern world.  A hundred years ago, society was reliant on about a dozen main metals. Now nearly the entire periodic table is needed to sustain our daily lives.  Rare earths have become a hot commodity, used as a bargaining chip in Donald Trumpâ€™s tariff wars, exposing supply chain vulnerabilities and highlighting Chinaâ€™s upper hand.  With mind-boggling names such as praseodymium, dysprosium, and ytterbium â€” not to be mistaken for yttrium â€” it can be easy to glaze over.  But due to critical mineralsâ€™ essential role in technologies, economies and national security, these elements will continue to demand attention.  So to truly understand just how critical these minerals have become, letâ€™s take a tour around the house.  By Annika Burgess with illustrations by Sharon Gordon for ABC News Digital. Social video by David Douglas Stuart for the ABC News Social Media Team.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Re-Spin: What is the point of sport? We asked Ben Crowe
description: Scottie Scheffler has done almost everything in golf. The world number one has multiple majors. He has millions in career earnings. And yet, he told us this year he does not find it fulfilling. Ahead of the British Open, a bit exasperated, he asked the press pack "what's the point?!" We're taking his surprising, sprawling, introspective press conference and getting renowned mental coach Ben Crowe to break it down for us. Crowe has worked with Ash Barty, Steph Gilmore, Dustin Martin and many more. He has some advice for Scheffler. Featured: Ben Crowe, mindset coach.   Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Trump promises Ukraine security guarantee before peace talks with Zelenskyy | ABC NEWS
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has met with US President Donald Trump at the latterâ€™s residence Mar-a-Lago in Florida to discuss ending the Ukraine war.  The US leader has ruled out a deadline for peace negotiations and promised a security agreement for Ukraine, touting that any peace deal would be â€˜of great economic benefitâ€™ to the Ukrainian people.  President Zelenskyy said a crucial condition for any peace deal was security guarantees for Ukraine and suggested a referendum to decide whether to cede territory to Russia.  President Trump said he would call Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin and European leaders after the meeting. title: Bondi shooting victimsâ€™ families demand royal commission into antisemitism | ABC NEWS
description: 17 families of victims of the Bondi Beach terror attack have written a letter demanding a federal royal commission into antisemitism.  The scathing statement accuses Australian security and law enforcement agencies of failing to protect the Jewish community amid a surge in antisemitism since the October 7th attack.  Sheina Gutnik, a daughter of a Bondi Beach shooting victim, says her family had lived in constant fear.  NSW Premier Chris Minns has expressed support for a state royal commission but Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has so far resisted calls to launch a federal version. title: Trump flags 'thorny' issues in Ukraine peace talks after Zelenskyy meeting | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump says â€˜thornyâ€™ issues remain in talks to end the Ukraine war after his meeting with Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy at Mar-a-Lago in Florida.  The two leaders spruiked constructive progress but were unable to define concessions that Russia and Ukraine would be willing to make.  Territory continues to be a sticking point despite the Ukrainian presidentâ€™s suggestion he could budge on the matter.  Kyiv wants to hold a referendum on whether to cede territory to Russia but Moscow is adamant about not agreeing to a ceasefire to facilitate the voting process. title: Myanmar election turnout below expectations as junta strikes rebel positions | ABC NEWS
description: Polling stations in Myanmar have closed after the first phase of the countryâ€™s elections, which only drew the participation of nearly a third of its townships.  The ruling military junta reportedly deployed fighter jets to relentlessly pound rebel positions during the voting period. The National League for Democracy, its main opposition led by jailed Nobel laureate Aung San Suu Kyiâ€™s, was barred from taking part.  The air strikes in active conflict zones meant millions of citizens were not able to vote, as doubts about the legitimacy of the elections continue to mount. title: Cops to carry long-armed firearms at NYE events in Sydney | ABC NEWS
description: New South Wales Police will be carrying long-armed firearms at major events, including  New Year's Eve in Sydney. It's one of several security changes the government is considering after the Bondi terror attack.  NSW Premier Chris Minns hasn't ruled out asking for the army to protect synagogues, saying nothing is off the table to keep the Jewish community safe.  Video by Isobel Roe, via ABC News NSW. description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Donald Trump have met at Mar-a-Lago to discuss a deal to end the war in Ukraine, with Mr Zelenskyy saying progress was made on the plan.
